content.question: Which of the following best describes how each source sees the consequences of the policies they advocate?

choices.label: Raudot sees state intervention as leading to rebellion by ungrateful workers, while the weavers see state intervention as aiding France.
Raudot sees reliance on charity from the wealthy as insufficient to meet the needs of the workers, leading to social disorder, and the weavers share this view.
Raudot sees reliance on charity from the wealthy as sufficient to meet the needs of the workers, preventing social disorder, and the weavers share this view.
Raudot sees state intervention as preventing rebellion by ungrateful workers, while the weavers see state intervention as undermining French national unity.

content.answer: Raudot sees state intervention as leading to rebellion by ungrateful workers, while the weavers see state intervention as aiding France.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
